projects.title: Stock Management APP
description: Designed and implemented a barcode-based stock management system, Stockly.
Streamlined inventory tracking, automated notifications, and barcode scanning for efficient stock management.

modal.detailedDescription: Stockly is a comprehensive barcode-based stock management system designed to streamline inventory operations for small to medium-sized businesses. The application integrates Power Automate workflows with Excel to provide real-time inventory tracking, automated low-stock notifications, and efficient barcode scanning capabilities.
features: Barcode scanning integration for quick product identification
Automated low-stock alerts via email notifications
Real-time inventory tracking and reporting
Excel-based database for easy data management
Power Automate workflows for process automation
User-friendly interface for non-technical users
challenges: Integrating barcode scanning hardware with Power Automate
Ensuring data accuracy across multiple Excel sheets
Designing efficient notification triggers without overwhelming users
Optimizing performance for large inventory databases
outcomes: Reduced inventory checking time by 70%
Eliminated manual data entry errors
Improved stock replenishment response time
Successfully deployed in school IT department

projects.title: NextCloud Private Cloud
description: Developed a secure private cloud storage solution using Raspberry Pi, Docker, and NextCloud.
Ensured data privacy and accessibility for personal and small business use.

modal.detailedDescription: A self-hosted private cloud storage solution built on Raspberry Pi 4, leveraging Docker containerization and NextCloud to provide secure, accessible file storage and collaboration features. The system offers complete data ownership and privacy while maintaining enterprise-level functionality.
features: Self-hosted cloud storage with full data ownership
Docker containerization for easy deployment and updates
SSL/TLS encryption for secure remote access
File synchronization across multiple devices
Collaborative document editing and sharing
Automated backup and versioning system
Mobile app integration for iOS and Android
challenges: Configuring secure external access through home network
Optimizing performance on Raspberry Pi hardware limitations
Setting up automated SSL certificate renewal
Implementing reliable backup strategies
Managing Docker container updates without downtime
outcomes: Successfully replaced commercial cloud subscriptions
Achieved 99.5% uptime over 3 months
Reduced cloud storage costs to zero after initial investment
Provided secure file access for family members
Gained hands-on experience with Docker and Linux server administration

projects.title: Python Snake Game
description: Built a classic Snake game using Python and Pygame.
Features include dynamic difficulty levels, poison blocks, and a high-score system.

modal.detailedDescription: A modern take on the classic Snake game developed with Python and Pygame, featuring enhanced gameplay mechanics, dynamic difficulty scaling, and a comprehensive scoring system. The game includes unique elements like poison blocks and power-ups to increase replay value and challenge.
features: Smooth animation and responsive controls
Dynamic difficulty system that adapts to player performance
Poison blocks mechanic for added challenge
Power-ups including speed boost and invincibility
High-score persistence using JSON file storage
Multiple color themes and visual effects
Pause and restart functionality
Game over statistics and performance tracking
challenges: Implementing collision detection with pixel-perfect accuracy
Balancing game difficulty to maintain engagement
Optimizing frame rate for smooth gameplay
Designing an intuitive UI with Pygame's limited GUI tools
Managing game state transitions cleanly
outcomes: Successfully implemented all planned features
Achieved stable 60 FPS performance
Received positive feedback from beta testers
Published on GitHub with comprehensive documentation
Gained proficiency in game development principles and Pygame library

projects.title: Eco Weighing System
description: Developed an IoT-integrated weighing system for tracking recycled materials.
Implemented QR code authentication for secure user identification.
Designed a web platform with database-driven analytics and secure login.

modal.detailedDescription: An IoT-enabled weighing system designed to track and incentivize recycling efforts in educational institutions. The system combines ESP32 microcontrollers, load cells, QR code authentication, and a web-based analytics platform to provide real-time tracking of recycled materials, user contributions, and environmental impact metrics.
features: ESP32-based IoT weighing stations with load cell integration
QR code authentication for secure user identification
Real-time weight data transmission to web server
MySQL database for persistent data storage
Web dashboard with analytics and visualizations
User leaderboard to gamify recycling efforts
Admin panel for system management and reporting
RESTful API for data exchange between hardware and web platform
challenges: Calibrating load cells for accurate weight measurements
Ensuring reliable WiFi connectivity in various locations
Designing a secure authentication system with QR codes
Implementing real-time data synchronization between ESP32 and server
Creating an intuitive web interface for both users and administrators
Handling concurrent requests from multiple weighing stations
outcomes: Successfully deployed in school environment with 3 weighing stations
Tracked over 500kg of recycled materials in first month
Increased student participation in recycling programs by 65%
Achieved 99% accuracy in weight measurements
Reduced administrative overhead for recycling tracking
Won school project competition for innovation and environmental impact

projects.title: Clockly – AWS Employee Attendance System
description: Built a cloud-based employee attendance tracking system on AWS for small and medium-sized companies.
Implemented secure authentication, automated reporting, and overtime management using multiple AWS services.
projects.technologies: AWS (EC2, Cognito, RDS, S3, Lambda, SNS, CloudWatch, EventBridge), Flask, PostgreSQL, DuckDNS, Let's Encrypt

modal.detailedDescription: Clockly is a cloud-based employee attendance tracking system designed for small and medium-sized companies. It allows employees to clock in and out through a secure web application hosted on AWS, demonstrating a real-world, enterprise-style cloud architecture with Flask backend on EC2 integrated with multiple AWS services.
features: AWS Cognito for secure authentication and role-based access (Worker, Team Leader, Admin)
AWS RDS (PostgreSQL) for storing users, teams, and attendance data
AWS S3 for daily attendance reports with Glacier for long-term archival
AWS Lambda for automation (auto clock-out and daily reporting)
AWS SNS for email notifications and alerts
AWS CloudWatch for logging, monitoring, and cost protection
Web-based clock-in/out with break tracking and accurate work-hour calculations
Automatic overtime management (warnings at 8 hours, auto clock-out at 10 hours)
Daily team attendance reports generated automatically and emailed to team leaders
Luxembourg timezone handling for consistent time calculations
DuckDNS + Let's Encrypt for HTTPS-secured external access
challenges: Configuring VPC networking for Lambda access
IAM permission troubleshooting
SSL certificate setup and HTTPS redirection
Secure inter-service communication
Private subnets for RDS with restricted security groups
outcomes: Successfully demonstrates a scalable, secure, and automated AWS-based attendance system
Reflects real enterprise cloud practices
Combines authentication, monitoring, automation, reporting, and cost-efficient storage
Complete production-style solution with health check API and systemctl-managed backend

projects.title: ITMOS – Network Monitoring with Zabbix
description: Designed and deployed a complete network and infrastructure monitoring solution using Zabbix.
Implemented centralized monitoring for network devices, servers, storage systems, and printers.
projects.technologies: Zabbix, Ubuntu Server, Proxmox, MariaDB, SNMP, VPN

modal.detailedDescription: This project focuses on the design, deployment, and validation of a complete network and infrastructure monitoring solution using Zabbix. Its goal was to ensure continuous availability, performance, and reliability of IT services in a virtualized environment while applying real-world monitoring best practices.
features: Zabbix Server with MariaDB database and web frontend
Zabbix Agents for server monitoring
SNMP monitoring for network devices, storage, and printers
HTTP/API checks for Proxmox and web services
Global NOC overview dashboard
Network & firewall monitoring dashboard
Servers & virtualization monitoring
Storage monitoring (Synology NAS)
Printers & consumables tracking
Zabbix server health monitoring
Fault, performance, availability, security, and capacity monitoring
challenges: SNMP configuration across different device types
VPN-related connectivity issues
Proxmox API permissions setup
Zabbix's steep learning curve
Template customization and community template integration
outcomes: Successfully validated through controlled tests (host failures, CPU load, SNMP misconfiguration)
Zabbix detected incidents, generated alerts, and confirmed automatic recovery
Demonstrates enterprise-ready monitoring solution
Improved understanding of real-world monitoring environments and troubleshooting techniques

projects.title: GCP AI Invoice Processing System
description: Implemented a serverless, AI-driven document processing pipeline on Google Cloud Platform.
Automatically extracts structured data from PDF invoices and stores it for analysis.
projects.technologies: Google Cloud (Cloud Storage, Cloud Functions, Document AI, BigQuery, Cloud Run), Python

modal.detailedDescription: This project implements a serverless, AI-driven document processing pipeline on Google Cloud Platform that automatically extracts structured data from PDF invoices and stores it for analysis. The solution demonstrates how multiple managed GCP services can be combined to build a scalable, real-world application with minimal infrastructure management.
features: Cloud Storage as the ingestion point for invoice PDFs
Cloud Functions (2nd gen) to orchestrate processing
Document AI (Invoice Parser) to extract structured invoice data
BigQuery to store and analyze extracted information
Cloud Run to host a web dashboard for uploads and data visualization
Fully event-driven and serverless architecture
Automatic extraction of invoice fields (invoice number, dates, supplier, totals, line items)
Fully automated after upload with no manual intervention required
challenges: Using the correct Document AI processor
Misconfigured processor paths (project number vs. project ID)
Inconsistent date formats causing BigQuery insertion failures
Cloud Run revisions not receiving traffic by default
Cloud Logging and incremental testing for debugging
outcomes: Successfully demonstrated practical, scalable, and automated invoice processing
Validated using public Cloud Run dashboard
Extracted invoice details correctly displayed and queryable in BigQuery
Highlights power of combining serverless services and AI

projects.title: RASP – Remote Access Student Portal
description: Built a Kubernetes-based remote desktop platform providing students instant access to virtual lab environments.
Replaced traditional physical PC labs with centrally managed virtual machines using Raspberry Pi kiosk clients.
projects.technologies: Kubernetes (k3s), Docker, Proxmox, Apache Guacamole, PostgreSQL, Raspberry Pi, Python

modal.detailedDescription: RASP is a Kubernetes-based remote desktop platform that provides students with instant access to virtual lab environments through Raspberry Pi kiosk clients. The system replaces traditional physical PC labs with centrally managed virtual machines, reducing long-term hardware costs and administrative overhead.
features: Session Broker - Central orchestrator for session requests and VM assignment
Pool Manager - Maintains pre-cloned VMs for instant startup
Cleanup Service - Removes inactive sessions and performs end-of-day cleanup
VM Controller - REST API gateway to Proxmox for VM operations
Teachers Portal - Web dashboard for monitoring and manual session control
Proxmox integration for VM lifecycle management
Apache Guacamole for browser-based VNC access
PostgreSQL for session and pool state
Raspberry Pi kiosks as thin clients
Instant VM provisioning using pre-warmed pool
Automated session cleanup and VM recycling
challenges: Microservices architecture design and orchestration
k3s cluster configuration and namespace isolation
Proxmox API integration for VM management
Session state synchronization between services
Docker containerization of all services
outcomes: Demonstrates production-grade Kubernetes deployment
Cost-efficient compared to maintaining physical PCs
Scalable and resilient through Kubernetes
Centralized control and monitoring
Minimal client requirements with Raspberry Pi kiosks

projects.title: ICode – Terraform Minecraft LAN Deployment
description: Automated the deployment of a Minecraft LAN environment using Terraform and Proxmox virtualization.
Compared Terraform providers and deployment strategies (on-premises vs. cloud) with team members Maksim Bogomolov and David Duraes.
projects.technologies: Terraform, Proxmox, Cloud-init, QEMU Agent, Ansible, Java 21, Paper, Geyser, Floodgate, Prism Launcher

modal.detailedDescription: This team project (with Maksim Bogomolov and David Duraes) automates the deployment of a complete Minecraft LAN environment using Terraform and Proxmox virtualization. The project compares two Proxmox Terraform providers — bpg/proxmox (better maintained, frequent updates) and telmate/proxmox (more downloads but less actively maintained) — and evaluates on-premises vs. cloud deployment strategies for infrastructure-as-code workflows.
features: Automated VM provisioning with Terraform on Proxmox
Comparison of bpg/proxmox and telmate/proxmox Terraform providers
On-premises vs. cloud deployment analysis
Minecraft server running Java 21 with Paper server software
Geyser and Floodgate plugins for cross-platform (Java & Bedrock) compatibility
Windows and Linux client VMs with Prism Launcher
Cloud-init templates for automated VM configuration
QEMU Guest Agent integration for VM management
challenges: Terraform compatibility issues on Windows with virtualization
VM lock timeouts during provisioning
Slow disk performance impacting deployment speed
Required parallelism=1 to avoid resource conflicts
Ansible limitations and workarounds on Windows hosts
outcomes: Successfully deployed a fully automated Minecraft LAN environment
Documented provider comparison to guide future Terraform-Proxmox projects
Demonstrated infrastructure-as-code principles in a practical, reproducible setup
Identified and documented workarounds for Windows-based Terraform workflows

contact.name: David Durães Valadares

reflection.title: My Semester 3 Journey
reflection.introduction: This semester has been a transformative period in my development as an IT professional. Through challenging projects, certifications, and hands-on experiences, I've grown both technically and personally.

sections.title: Progress & Key Moments
content: At the beginning of the semester, I set ambitious goals: complete multiple Microsoft certifications, build impactful projects, and deepen my understanding of cloud technologies. Looking back, I'm proud to say I've exceeded many of these expectations.

A defining 'Aha!' moment came during the AZ-900 preparation when I finally understood how Azure's identity management connects with on-premises Active Directory. This conceptual breakthrough made everything click and boosted my confidence significantly.

The Stock Management project taught me the value of automation and how Power Automate can transform repetitive tasks. Seeing the system work in a real environment validated months of design and testing work.

sections.title: Strengths Demonstrated
content: Problem-Solving: The Eco Weighing System project showcased my ability to integrate hardware (ESP32), software (PHP/MySQL), and user experience design into a cohesive solution. When the load cells gave inconsistent readings, I researched calibration techniques and implemented a software-based solution.

Self-Directed Learning: My Pluralsight journey demonstrates my commitment to continuous improvement. Without external pressure, I've completed courses and practice exams, consistently pushing toward the AZ-104 certification.
Adaptability: Whether configuring Docker containers for NextCloud or writing Python games with Pygame, I've shown I can quickly learn new technologies and apply them effectively.
Documentation: All my projects include comprehensive documentation, making them maintainable and shareable with others.

sections.title: Challenges & Areas for Improvement
content: Time Management: Balancing multiple certifications, projects, and coursework was challenging. I sometimes underestimated task complexity, leading to rushed finishes. I'm implementing better estimation techniques using task breakdown and buffer time.

Networking Deep Dive: While I understand networking fundamentals (CCNA 1-3), I want to develop more advanced troubleshooting skills. My plan includes more hands-on lab work with packet analysis and network simulation.

Public Speaking: Presenting technical concepts to non-technical audiences remains challenging. I'm working on this by explaining my projects to family and friends, practicing clear communication without jargon.
Perfectionism: I sometimes spend too much time optimizing code that's already functional. Learning when 'good enough' truly is enough is an ongoing lesson.

sections.title: Looking Forward
content: Next semester, my primary goal is completing the AZ-104 certification, building on the solid foundation I've established this semester.
I want to contribute to open-source projects, putting my skills to use in the broader developer community.
Exploring cybersecurity more deeply is a priority, as it aligns with my ultimate goal of becoming an Azure Security Engineer (AZ-500).
I'm committed to improving my soft skills, particularly communication and teamwork, as these are essential for any IT professional.

reflection.conclusion: Semester 3 has been a journey of discovery, challenge, and growth. Every certification earned, every project completed, and every obstacle overcome has shaped me into a more capable IT professional. I'm grateful for the experiences, the lessons learned, and excited for what lies ahead. The path to becoming an Azure Security Engineer is clearer than ever, and I'm ready for the next steps.
